newsitem.title: INDIA: India Crisil reiterates rating on Vijaya Bank CDs.
newsitem.headline: India Crisil reiterates rating on Vijaya Bank CDs.

text.p: The rating for Vijaya Bank's certificate of deposit (CD) programme has been reaffirmed at P2 (pronounced P two) and removed it from rating watch, the Credit Rating Information Services of India Ltd (Crisil) said.
The instrument was put on rating watch in July 1996, after indications that the bank's profitability and capital adequacy for the year ended March 31, 1996 would be severly impaired.

Further, there was uncertainty regarding the impact of the announcement of the results on the deposit mobilisation of the bank. A final view on the rating was to be taken after these issues became clearer, Crisil said.

Developments in the past six months indicate that there has been an overall growth in the deposits. This has enabled the bank to substantially reduce the level of high cost certificate of deposits in its overall mix of deposits, it said.

While the uncertainty regarding the timing of the infusion of funds by the government continues, the due date for achieving capital adequacy has been extended for Vijaya Bank by the Reserve Bank of India, Crisil said.
